posts.caption: gizmo.do
posts.description: Dodging firewalls and masking your IP address usually requires firing up separate—often paid-for—software or plug-ins while you’re browsing. Now, though, Opera has its own free VPN baked right into the desktop browser.

posts.caption: werockyourweb.com
posts.description: Want to keep your team connected and productive? You need a good online collaboration tool. We review Slack, Basecamp, Trello, Asana, Teamwork, and more.

posts.message:
no more dependencies hell ? 

"Snap packages can (though don’t have to) contain both application binary and any dependencies required for it to run. Yup, even if those libraries are already installed on the host system.
...
Applications packaged in the format are isolated from the rest of the system. You can install a snappy package without worrying about what it might do to other software you have installed."
posts.caption: omgubuntu.co.uk
posts.description: Ubuntu 16.04 LTS will come with support for Canonical's (relatively new) Snap packaging format.

posts.message: كنت عايز أكتب برنامج بالجافا client-server وعايزه يستكشف الشبكة (ياعني يعرف لو كان ف نسخة من البرنامج ده موجوده على جهاز تاني ف الشبكة ولا لأ) دورت ولاقيت إن في حلين  - تقريباً ياعني - واحد فيهم إني أستخدم MulticastSocket والحل التاني إني أستخدم broadcast IP 255.255.255.255 ف السؤال هنا ياعني هو إيه الفرق بين الإتنين؟ وأنهو الأنسب؟ وهل في حلول تانية بسيطة ولا ﻷ؟ شكراً مقدماً.

posts.message: If anyone has #WordPress #development related #question, just mention me and I would be happy for help, thanks

Do you Remember the Hacking Team breach? The security company that sells spy tools to governments including Egypt and got hacked. 
The hacker who made the breach and posted 400gb of its mail and data on the internet has made a detailed write-up about how he hacked the company. He even included links in his write-up about the tools he used. 
The first write-up was written in Spanish then he released the translation in English.
http://motherboard.vice.com/read/hacking-team-ceo-bashes-sensationalist-media-and-vigilante-hacker

The long and detailed write-up in English: http://pastebin.com/raw/0SNSvyjJ
posts.caption: motherboard.vice.com
posts.description: The surveillance company reacts after the vigilante hacker Phineas Fisher explained how he broke into its servers.
